page.title: 04MACKAYS COURT FARM
page.content: {Mackays Court Farm}is part of a 1,800 acre farm, which is owned partly by the Church and partly by Mr.Castle, who farms it. The farmhouse is situated between Middle and Lower Stoke and the land forms almost a complete circle around the village. Mr. B.Stone is the manager and lives in the farmhouse with his wife and two young children. He employs eleven full_time workers and up to one hundred part_time workers. The main crops are corn, early potatoes, spring greens, calabrese and sweetcorn. Beef cattle graze the marshes during the summer, but are kept in sheltered yards through the winter. With all these enterprises the farm is a very lively and interesting place to work.
